definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: The child lived but had major medical problems including oxygen deprivation and bleeding in the brain.
sentences.chinese: 小孩存活了下來，但患有缺氧及腦出血等嚴重病症。

sentences.english: Not only can walking fish live out of water but they can also travel short distances over land.
sentences.chinese: 鮎魚不僅可以離開水存活，還可以在岸上短間隔移動。

sentences.english: At this stage they are reliant on their mother's milk.
sentences.chinese: 在這個階段需以母獅的奶存活。

sentences.english: They were nearly four times as likely to live long after bypass surgery as were the unmarried.
sentences.chinese: 她們搭橋手術後的存活率幾乎是未婚者的4倍。

sentences.english: It may survive and give rise to two mononucleate hybrid cells called synkaryons .
sentences.chinese: 可存活併產生兩個稱爲合核體的單核的雜種細胞。

sentences.english: Probiotics contain live micro-organisms, so-called good bacteria that colonize the intestine.
sentences.chinese: 益生菌含有活力微生物，可以在腸道內存活繁殖。

sentences.english: Only the strongest could survive here.
sentences.chinese: 只有最強者才能存活下來。

sentences.english: Gorged with power, I grew blind to Pokemon being alive.
sentences.chinese: 因貪嗜權力，竟令小生對神奇寶貝之存活盲目不見。
這些植物歷經寒霜而存活了。

sentences.english: Because, we Swedes, without herrings , we, Scandinavian country, we couldn't live.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典人和北歐人沒有鯡魚即無法存活至今。

sentences.english: Bivariate survival analysis has received substantial attentions due to its wide applications.
sentences.chinese: 雙變數存活分析已被廣泛應用於生物醫學的研究。

sentences.english: In humid conditions , it can survive on land for several days.
sentences.chinese: 在潮溼的環境中，攀鱸可於陸地上存活數天。

sentences.english: The death group has higher blood glucose level than the survival group.
sentences.chinese: 死亡組較存活組應激性血糖濃度高。

sentences.english: Some speculate that it may be a plesiosaur that survived the rest of the dinosaur population.
sentences.chinese: 一些人猜測這可能是恐龍中存活下來的蛇頸龍。

sentences.english: Rescorla implicitly understood that he could turn office workers into survivors.
sentences.chinese: 瑞斯寇拉深深瞭解他可以將辦公室員工變成存活者。

sentences.english: Results The cell livability of continuous exposure chemotherapy group was significantly lower than that of the group from once exposure chemotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 結果持續給藥組細胞存活率顯著低於一次性給藥組。

definition: to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
to live in or on another organism as a parasite/to live by taking advantage of others/parasitism/parasitic
